revised_title: The Absorption of Radiation Emitted by a Palladium Anticathode in Rhodium, Palladium, and Silver
tldr: The author investigates the absorption coefficients of the radiation emitted by a palladium anticathode in rhodium, palladium, and silver using an X-ray spectrometer. The study reveals that the energy in the spectrum is localized in the characteristic wavelengths of the metal of the anticathode, with the ratio of the intensity of the characteristic rays to the rest of the spectrum being nearly 1:1.
